commitMessage:
fix(status): correctly distinguish production-ready from shipped state

## What Changed
- Fixed `checkShipped()` in status.ts to check for `shipCommit` field instead of `validationPassed`
- Fixed `checkProductionReady()` to properly check `validationPassed` instead of calling `checkShipped()`
- Updated type imports to use `ShipRecordData` from ship-service.ts
- Added null checks for Partial<ShipRecordData> fields in stats calculations
- Removed obsolete `shipChecks` field reference (replaced by `qualityResults` in HODGE-356)
- Modified 7 files: 341 insertions, 47 deletions

## Why This Change
The `hodge status` command was incorrectly reporting features as "Shipped" when they had only completed the harden phase. The bug was in line 95 of status.ts, which checked `validationPassed` (set by `/harden`) instead of `shipCommit` (set by `/ship`). This caused confusion about feature state and made it appear that features were shipped before commits were actually created.

## Impact
- **Status Accuracy**: `hodge status` now correctly distinguishes between:
  - โ Production Ready (harden completed, `validationPassed === true`)
  - โ Shipped (commit created, `shipCommit` field exists)
- **Developer Experience**: No more confusion about whether a feature has actually been committed
- **Workflow Integrity**: Maintains clear separation between harden validation and actual shipping
- **Type Safety**: Improved TypeScript type checking with proper `ShipRecordData` usage

๐ค Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
